title: Vase, ca. 1925
markings: On underside of vase, painted in red enamel: "JEAN DUNAND" / "-4998-"
provenance: Linda Lichtenberg Kaplan; 2004: acquired by Museum (from Historical Design)
dimensions: H x diam.: 15.3 x 17 cm (6 x 6 11/16 in.)
description: Globular form, the brass surface with caramel-colored patination and black and cinnabar-colored lacquer geometric decoration of curving lines and dashes, and cinnabar and gun-metal gray colored fields; circular mouth with nickled collar.
justification:
From Acquisition Justification:
"This great example of Art Deco design is both executed and designed by Jean Dunand, a designer known for his work with lacquer and enamel techniques."

tombstone.epitaph: Vase, ca. 1925. Raised brass, hand-painted lacquer, nickel (rim). Gift of Linda Lichtenberg Kaplan. 2004-21-1.
